intro: Hymenatherum berlandieri, commonly known as the Berlandier's hibiscus, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and are typically borne on long, slender pedicels. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Hymenatherum berlandieri thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks.
